bleeding.name: Bleeding
bleeding.description: You're bleeding, afflicted with a grievous wound that is difficult to treat. You suffer one Mortal Wound at the end of each of your Turns. Bleeding can be stopped with a successful Toughness Test (DN 4), or if another character aids you with the Medicae Skill. You can attempt to use Medicae on yourself but do so at +1 DN.

blinded.name: Blinded
blinded.description: You're unable to see properly. Increase the DN for any sight-related task (including all combat Tests) by 4, replacing any lesser vision penalties. At the GM's discretion you may use a Combat Action to remove the Blinded condition, using a narratively appropriate Skill.

exhausted.name: Exhausted
exhausted.description: You are weary from battle or persistent effort and suffer from fatigue. On your Turn, you can only Walk or Crawl, perform a basic Combat Action (attack with no combat options, such as Aim or Multi-Attack), or Fall Back. Additionally, you may not roll Determination. Any Shock suffered by an Exhausted character is immediately converted into Mortal Wounds. Certain circumstances directly inflict Exhaustion. You are automatically Exhausted if your Shock increases beyond your Maximum Shock. Certain weapons, psychic powers, or Ruin Actions can also cause you to become Exhausted even while you are below your Maximum Shock. If you are Exhausted from a source other than exceeding your Maximum Shock, that effect determines how you remove the Exhausted condition. Otherwise, the Exhausted condition is removed whenever you recover Shock.

fear.name: Fear
fear.description: You're scared. Whatever is causing your Fear might also make you anxious, or trigger physical reactions like rapid breathing, shaking, and a lack of focus. When you encounter something that causes Fear, you roll your Resolve against a DN dictated by the source of Fear. Success allows you to act normally. If you fail, you suffer +2DN to all Tests. The penalty lasts until the end of the scene or until an ally passes a Leadership (Wil) Test of DN 2 + the source's Fear value. A being that causes Fear is immune to Fear and Intimidation Interaction Attacks.

frenzied.name: Frenzied
frenzied.description: Whether whipped into a zealous fury or auto injecting Frenzon combat stims, you're Frenzied. You lose all sense of self-preservation and throw yourself into the thick of combat. When you become Frenzied, you may choose to embrace the frenzy or attempt to resist it. If you choose to resist, at the start of your Turn make a DN 3 Willpower Test. If you pass, the rage subsides and you resist the frenzy. If the effect is triggered, embraced, or otherwise not resisted, you are Frenzied and must try to get into close combat as quickly as possible, charging the nearest visible enemy. If you are in cover, you break cover and move towards the nearest enemy. While Frenzied, you are immune to Fear and cannot be Pinned and must always use the All-Out Attack option, if possible. You gain +1 to your Strength Attribute while Frenzied.

hindered.name: Hindered
hindered.description: Something's holding you back. While Hindered increase the DN for all Tests by +1, or higher if the rules of whatever is hindering you say so. Hindered lasts until the end of the next Turn, unless otherwise stated.

on_fire.name: On Fire
on_fire.description: You're on fire! You take 1d3 Mortal Wounds at the start of each of your Turns. You may then use your Action to throw yourself Prone and roll around in an attempt to extinguish the fire with a DN 3 Athletics (S) Test. If you succeed you are no longer On Fire. Alternatively, you can attempt to ignore the flames and take your Turn as normal. Make a DN 3 Willpower Test; if you fail, you are Hindered.

pinned.name: Pinned
pinned.description: You're under heavy fire, and there's a chance your Resolve will break under pressure. If you are targeted with a Pinning Attack, you may be Pinned. If someone uses a Pinning Attack against you, they make a Ballistic Skill (A) Test against your Resolve. If they succeed you are Pinned until the start of the attacker's next Turn. If you're behind cover, you hunker down. If you aren't behind cover, you immediately move to the nearest cover, using your Movement for your next Turn. While Pinned, you can't leave cover, but may take other Actions as normal. You suffer a +2 DN penalty to Ballistic Skill (A) Tests when you target an enemy using a Pinning Attacks against you. You may attempt to rally Pinned comrades on your Turn by making a Leadership (Wil) Test as an Action, with a DN equal to the enemy weapon's Salvo value, adding an extra +1 DN if a Pinned character has taken any damage (Shock or Wounds) during the combat. If the Test is successful, you rally any Pinned allies within 5 metres, ending the effect.

poisoned.name: Poisoned
poisoned.description: You've been inflicted with one of the galaxy's countless pathogens, plagues, or viruses. You could be suffering from neurotoxins injected into your system, alien acid splashed on you, or Nurgle's contagions. All of these dangers leave you Poisoned. You suffer a +2 DN penalty to all Tests while Poisoned. Some poisons also inflict damage based on the poison. Some poisons may affect your ability to function instead of, or in addition to, causing damage. The Poisoned condition ends when you are treated using the Medicae Skill or you succeed on a Toughness Test (DN based on the poison) at the beginning of your Turn.

prone.name: Prone
prone.description: You're knocked down on the ground. Your Defence is reduced by 2 against any attack made by a Threat within 5 metres of you. Your Defence is increased by 1 when you're attacked from 6 or more metres away. If you become Prone while flying, you fall to the ground and suffer falling damage. Standing up when Prone is a Free Action on your Turn. If you stand up in this way, you can only use the Standard Movement option; you can't use combat options such as Brace or Aim. An adjacent character may use a Simple Action to help you stand up immediately when you're Prone.

restrained.name: Restrained
restrained.description: You're bound, possibly by some form of entangling attack such as a Genestealer Cultist Webber, a Barbed Strangler, or a good old-fashioned net. While Restrained you can't use your Movement and your Defence is reduced by 2.

staggered.name: Staggered
staggered.description: You're off balance; you've run too fast over rough terrain, ordnance has impacted nearby, or you've been clipped by a stray bullet. When you move while Staggered, your Speed is reduced by half. You can't Run or Sprint unless otherwise stated. The Staggered condition lasts until the end of your next Turn.

terror.name: Terror
terror.description: You're overcome with a sense of intense dread and rational thought becomes impossible: this is all-consuming Terror. Make a Resolve Test against the DN of the source of Terror. If you pass, you may act normally on your Turn. If you fail, you suffer all of the effects of Fear, and you must use every action available on each of your Turns to move as far away as possible until you no longer have line of sight to the source of Terror. Terror lasts until the end of the scene or until an ally passes a Leadership (Wil) Test of DN 2 + the Terror value. Any effect that grants a bonus to Fear Tests also applies to Terror Tests. Any effect that grants immunity to Fear grants one extra Icon on your Resolve Test against Terror. A being that causes Terror is immune to Fear, Terror, and Intimidation Interaction Attacks.

vulnerable.name: Vulnerable
vulnerable.description: Your defences are open! While Vulnerable, you suffer -1 to your Defence. Certain abilities and effects increase this penalty. Being Vulnerable lasts until the end of your next Turn.

charge.name: Charge
charge.description: You can Charge a target as a Full-Round Action. When you Charge, you move up to double your Speed and make a melee attack Test with +1 bonus dice. You must move at least 4 metres to Charge.

combat_action.name: Combat Action
combat_action.description: Combat Actions require your primary focus in a combat Round, taking the most effort to achieve. Combat Actions are usually your main objective during your Turn. You may perform a single Combat Action (or Action) in a Turn. Combat Actions include, but are not limited to, the following: Making an attack. Using a Skill to make an Interaction Attack. Using a Skill or object that requires time and attention, such as a Medicae (Int) Test. There are other activities that may also count as Combat Actions, such as using certain psychic powers.

critical_hit.name: Critical Hit
critical_hit.description: If you hit and the Wrath Die result is a 6, then the target suffers a Wrath Critical. The group also gains one point of Glory. You can spend Glory to increase the power of a Critical Hit.

free_action.name: Free Action
free_action.description: Some actions take little thought, concentration, or time to perform. So little, in fact, that they can be performed while doing other things without any penalty and may be performed outside of your Turn. These are called 'Free Actions'. The GM is the final arbiter on how many Free Actions you can perform in a Turn or Round. Free Actions include but are not limited to: Shouting a warning or a short sentence. Opening an unlocked door. Using Psyniscience. Rolling Determination to reduce damage. Several Talents and pieces of Wargear may allow some Simple Actions to be performed as Free Actions. Free Actions should add to the narrative of the game and should never arbitrarily extend a Turn.

interaction_attack.name: Interaction Attack
interaction_attack.description: Wily characters can use their Skills to trick, disorient, stun, or otherwise hinder a target, leaving them vulnerable. The DN of an Interaction Attack is the foe's opposing Skill Rating or Resolve, whichever is higher. The following Skills can be used to make Interaction Attacks: Athletics to push your enemy. Deception to manipulate your enemy into a poor position. Intimidate to menace your enemy, cowing them. Persuasion to throw your enemy off balance with careful words. Tech to use nearby technology to confuse or weaken your enemy. If your Interaction Attack Test equals or exceeds the DN, several effects are possible. You must choose to make the target Hindered or Vulnerable; this effect lasts until the start of your next turn. If multiple targets are affected by the same Interaction Attack, all targets suffer the same effect. Shifts may be used to increase the Defence or DN penalty by 1 for each Shift. Player's Call: If you Shift 3 or more Exalted Icons on an Interaction Attack, the result is a 'Player's Call'. You can negotiate with the GM to trigger an effect of your choice that is appropriate to the circumstances.

mob.name: Mob
mob.description: A Mob is a group of near identical Threats, like a crowd of ten Ork Boyz. Mobs have additional rules for how they act and take damage as a unit.

move_action.name: Movement
move_action.description: On your Turn, you can make a Movement or use a Movement Option. There are several options for Movement in and out of combat. Often anything other than Standard Movement requires a Simple or Combat Action. Movement options include: Standard Movement, Running, Sprinting, Crawling, Jumping, Swimming, Flying, and Climbing.

reflexive_action.name: Reflexive Action
reflexive_action.description: Certain actions can be made outside of your Turn. These are known as Reflexive Actions, and under normal circumstances you may only make one per Round. You usually make a Reflexive Action in response to an action someone else makes on their Turn.

seize_initiative.name: Seize the Initiative
seize_initiative.description: Whenever an Agent has finished their Turn for the Round, the players can Seize the Initiative. Instead of the initiative order passing to a Threat, the players may choose to spend one Glory to have another Agent act instead. This can only be done once before the Threats take their Turn. The GM may spend one Ruin to Seize the Initiative for a Threat in the same way.

simple_action.name: Simple Action
simple_action.description: Simple Actions take less time and concentration to perform than Combat Actions but still represent significant effort and focus. You may perform one Simple Action per Turn. Simple Actions include but are not limited to: Reloading a weapon. Drawing or readying a weapon. Kicking open a locked door. Looking around with your Awareness (Int) Skill. You might also be able to use your Simple Action to activate a piece of Wargear, for specific Skill Tests, to use abilities, or to activate certain psychic powers.

stealth_score.name: Stealth Score
stealth_score.description:
You can make a Stealth (A) Test as a Combat Action. Whenever you do this (or whenever the GM calls for a Stealth (A) Test), write down the number of Icons you roll. This is your Stealth Score for the scene. Whenever another character uses their Passive Awareness or makes an Awareness (Int) Test, they use your Stealth Score for the DN of their Test. If the enemy discovers you, you lose your Stealth Score for the scene. You can't roll Stealth (A) again until the next scene, as dictated by the GM. Your Stealth Score can be decreased through various actions, and is ultimately adjudicated by the GM.

Stealth Score Reduction
ActionScore Reduction
Whispering. Readying a quiet weapon. Snapping a twig.-1
Talking softly. Readying a weapon with moving parts, such as racking a Stubber. Reloading.-2
Talking normally. Attacking an unaware target with a Knife. Firing a weapon with the MELTA Keyword, generating a loud hiss. Activating any Wargear that generates light.-3
A sword duel. Engaging a grav-vehicle's engines. Firing a weapon with the FLAME Keyword. Shouting or screaming. Revving a weapon with the CHAIN Keyword.-4
Firing a weapon with the ARC, LAS, PLASMA, or PROJECTILE Keywords. Engaging a Jump Pack or a promethium-fueled vehicle's engines.-5
Firing a weapon with the BOLT Keyword. Triggering an explosive. Engaging a flying vehicle's jet engines.-6

ambush.name: Ambush
ambush.description: Characters that are unaware of or unprepared for a combat situation are considered ambushed. The GM decides which (if any) characters are ambushed at the start of combat. Ambushed characters don't get a Turn in the first Round. Once all characters that weren't ambushed have had a Turn, the combat proceeds using normal initiative order — no one is considered ambushed after the first Round. You can choose to spend a point of Glory to make your character aware of an ambush and take your Turn as normal. The GM can do the same for a Threat by spending a point of Ruin.

multi_action.name: Multi-Action
multi_action.description: You can attempt more than one Combat Action in a Round, but doing so makes all Combat Actions you take more difficult. You can't take more than one Attack Action by using a Multi-Action. First, declare that you are making a Multi-Action, and say which actions you want to take. For every additional Action you declare, you suffer a +2 DN penalty to all Tests made as part of an Action that Turn. So, if you make two Actions, you have a +2 DN penalty on both of those Tests, and if you make three Actions you have a +4 DN penalty on all three Tests.

full_round_action.name: Full-Round Action
full_round_action.description: Performing a Full-Round Action prevents you from taking any other actions (except Free Actions) and you can't make a Movement unless that is part of the Full-Round Action. Some examples of Full-Round Actions are: Sprinting, Full Defence, and certain psychic powers.

standard_movement.name: Standard Movement
standard_movement.description: During a Turn you can move your Speed in metres. You don't have to use all of your Movement; you can move as little as you want or not at all. There is no additional Movement cost for changing elevation if you are using an incline, stairs, or a ladder. You may take any other Action at any point during a Standard Movement, unless the rules for that Action state otherwise.

running.name: Running
running.description: When you Run, you move double your Speed in metres. If you Run, you may not perform a Simple Action during your Turn, and you cannot Run if you've already performed a Simple Action during your Turn.

sprinting.name: Sprinting
sprinting.description: When you Sprint, you move triple your Speed in metres in a straight line. Sprinting is a Full-Round Action.

crawling.name: Crawling
crawling.description: You can Crawl half your Speed in metres; you are Prone while Crawling.

jumping.name: Jumping
jumping.description: You can hurdle obstacles up to 1 metre high or leap over gaps up to 1 metre in length as part of your standard Movement. Making a Long Jump or High Jump beyond these limits is a Simple Action, and requires an Athletics (S) Test with a DN determined by the GM based on the current circumstances. Your Long Jump distance is equal to your Strength in metres. Your High Jump is equal to a quarter of your Strength in metres. If you Jump onto Difficult Terrain, you must make an additional DN 3 Athletics (S) Test to avoid falling Prone.

swimming.name: Swimming
swimming.description: Your Speed is halved while swimming. If you begin your Turn in the water you can swim half your Speed in metres. If the GM determines that whatever you're swimming through is Difficult Terrain, they may call for an Athletics (S) Test to make progress. The GM decides how many Athletics (S) Tests are needed to Swim through the area, the DN of all Tests, and the difficulty of any other action taken while Swimming. If you become submerged for an extended period of time, fall unconscious, or are Dying while swimming, you may begin to drown.

flying.name: Flying
flying.description: Flying allows you to move a number of metres equal to either your Speed, or a Speed indicated by the method of flight (in your ability or Wargear text). Flying ignores terrain penalties and can move over (but not through) other characters. If you are knocked Prone while flying, you fall from the sky.

climbing.name: Climbing
climbing.description: You can use your Movement to Climb at half your Speed in metres. You can attempt to Climb at a faster rate, but at the risk of falling. If you succeed on a DN 3 Athletics (S) Test, you may instead climb a number of metres up to your Speed. Using both your Movement and Simple Action reduces the DN of the Athletics (S) Test by 1. Using both your Movement and Combat Action reduces the DN of the Athletics (S) Test by 2.

difficult_terrain.name: Difficult Terrain
difficult_terrain.description: Any terrain the GM considers 'difficult' reduces your Speed by half. This could be shin-high sewage clinging to your boots, sharp rubble that shifts wherever you stand, or something else entirely.

cover.name: Cover
cover.description: Cover represents the protection gained from seeking shelter from incoming fire. Characters concealed from their attacker gain a bonus to Defence. If less than half of your character is concealed, they receive +1 Defence. If half or more of your character is concealed, the bonus increases to +2 Defence.

moving_stealthily.name: Moving Stealthily
moving_stealthily.description: By staying low and sticking to cover or the shadows you can move unseen and unheard. You may use a Combat Action and your Movement to Move Stealthily. You move at half your Speed in metres and cannot Run or Sprint while Moving Stealthily.

surprise_attack.name: Surprise Attack
surprise_attack.description: If you attack an unaware enemy, you gain 2 bonus dice to the Attack Test and +2 ED. If a Surprise Attack starts a combat, the target is also ambushed. The attack is likely to reduce your Stealth Score; any decrease is resolved after the attack.

unarmed_strike.name: Unarmed Strike
unarmed_strike.description: You can attack hand-to-hand without wielding a melee weapon, using the normal rules for attacking. An unarmed strike uses your Strength Attribute as the Damage value and has +1 ED.

engaged.name: Engaged
engaged.description: Combatants who are within their opponent's melee range are considered to be Engaged in close combat. If you are Engaged in close combat, you can only attack targets you are Engaged with. You cannot fire a ranged weapon while Engaged unless it has the Pistol Trait.

reflexive_attack.name: Reflexive Attack
reflexive_attack.description: If you are Engaged with an enemy and they choose to move out of Engagement, you may use your Reflexive Action to make a melee attack against them. If you move out of Engagement with an enemy, they may do the same. You cannot make a Reflexive Attack if your target uses the Fall Back Combat Action.

pistols_in_melee.name: Pistols In Melee
pistols_in_melee.description: You can fire a weapon with the Pistol Trait when Engaged in close combat. Any Ballistic Skill (A) Tests you make while you are Engaged suffer a +2 DN penalty. You can't Aim and don't gain a bonus for being in Short Range, but you can use other ranged combat options and weapon traits, such as Rapid Fire.

reloading.name: Reloading
reloading.description: You can spend a Simple Action to Reload one ranged weapon, expending one point of Ammo. This may be required to fire your weapon after using a Salvo Option or due to a Complication. Weapons with a Salvo rating of '–' must be Reloaded after every shot. If you don't use a Simple Action to Reload a weapon when required, the weapon can't be used again until it is Reloaded.

salvo.name: Salvo
salvo.description:
Most ranged weapons have a Salvo rating which is used for the following options. After you use any of these options you must Reload your weapon before you can fire it again. A weapon with a Salvo of '-' can't be used for Salvo Options.

Full Auto: You empty your entire clip firing at a single target. You gain a number of bonus dice to your attack Test equal to the weapon's Salvo value.

Spray Shot: You spray ammunition at multiple targets. You can make a Spray Shot as part of a Multi-Attack, reducing the DN of the Test by the weapon's Salvo value. This can't decrease the DN by more than the penalty imposed by the Multi-Attack.

Spray Shot Vs Mobs: You can target a Mob with a Spray Shot as a Full-Round Action. Make a ranged attack Test against the Mob as normal. If your attack is successful, you hit an additional number of individuals in the Mob equal to the weapon's Salvo value.

firing_into_melee.name: Firing Into Melee
firing_into_melee.description: When using a ranged attack against a target who is Engaged in melee, there is a chance the shot goes awry. If the Wrath Die result is a 1, the ranged attack is made against a random target in the melee instead of the chosen target. Choose one of the combatants randomly, excluding the intended target. If the Attack Test result beats their Defence, then roll damage against that new target. You may choose to shift Exalted Icons from the Attack Test to the damage roll after the target has been assigned as usual. If you use the Aim combat option, you can negate the penalties for firing into melee instead of taking the regular Aim bonus.

area_effect_weapons.name: Area Effect Weapons
area_effect_weapons.description: Area effect weapons, such as grenades, missiles, and other explosives, have the Blast (X) Trait. When you fire or throw a Blast weapon, choose any point in range (including another character!), then make a DN 3 Ballistic Skill (A) Test. Apply Range effects as normal unless you are using a thrown weapon like a grenade. If you fail the Test, the attack misses and Scatters. If you succeed, the explosion is centered on your target. If you are measuring distance, the Blast rating determines the radius of the explosion in metres. Anyone inside this radius is hit by the attack. If you are targeting a Mob, the number of individuals in the Mob hit by the explosion is equal to half of the Blast rating. If you are using a theater of the mind approach, you can use this number as a shorthand to determine how many proximate targets are hit — the GM might decide a Frag Grenade hits 3 Cultists charging through the grand hall of an abbey, rather than applying the radius of the explosion. You cannot Shift to increase the damage of a Blast weapon. If you inflict a Critical Hit with a Blast weapon, the effects apply to all targets hit by the attack.

scattering.name: Scattering
scattering.description: If your Ballistic Skill (A) Test for an area effect weapon fails, you miss your target, and the weapon lands somewhere other than the intended target area. This is called Scattering. Roll 1d6 to determine the direction of the scatter. Then roll another 1d6 and double the result for the distance in metres that the attack deviates by.

dodging_area_effects.name: Dodging Area Effect Attacks
dodging_area_effects.description: If you are caught in a Blast radius or hit by a Flamer, you may attempt the Full Defence combat option, adding 1 + any Icons rolled to your Resilience instead of your Defence. You can dive for cover, but you might not escape the full explosion or shrapnel. The GM may decide that some area effect attacks can't be dodged or avoided. Area effect attacks with Blast (6) or more, or a radius of over 10m are usually too big to escape in this way.

called_shot.name: Called Shot
called_shot.description:
You can make an attack a called shot by declaring a target, such as a gap in some armour, an eye, or a vulnerable joint. Your attack suffers a DN penalty dependent on the size of your target. If you hit, you gain Extra Damage dice equal to the DN penalty.

Called Shots
SizeDN PenaltyExtra Damage Dice
Medium (arm or leg)1+1 ED
Small (hand, head)2+2 ED
Tiny (eye-slit, armour joint)3+3 ED

shot_to_disarm.name: Shot To Disarm
shot_to_disarm.description: Called shots may be used to disarm an opponent by shooting their weapon or the hand that holds it. If the attack hits, the victim must make a Strength Test against a DN equal to half the attack's total Damage. If they fail, they drop their weapon. Using a called shot to disarm does not award additional ED, and the shot itself does not deal any Damage.

shot_to_bypass_armour.name: Shot To Bypass Armour
shot_to_bypass_armour.description: Called shots may also bypass a target's armour. This might include shooting at a target's head who is not wearing a helmet or targeting an area of weaker armour. The GM determines how much armour you bypass when using this called shot.

full_defence.name: Full Defence
full_defence.description: You can use a Full-Round Action to focus on dodging incoming attacks. Your Speed is reduced by half, and you must make an Initiative Attribute Test. Until the end of your Turn your Defence increases by 1, +1 for every Icon rolled in the Initiative Attribute Test. You can activate Full Defence as a Reflexive Action. If you do so, you can't perform Movement, Combat Actions or Simple Actions on your next Turn.

hold_action.name: Hold Action
hold_action.description: You may choose to wait and act later in the Round. To do so, announce you are holding your Combat Action instead of taking it during your Turn. You may announce you are using your held Combat Action at any point later in the Round. If you wish to Interrupt another character, you must succeed at an opposed Initiative Test. Failure means that the acting character takes their action first before you have the chance to intervene. If you don't use your held Combat Action by the end of the Round it is lost.

multi_attack.name: Multi-Attack
multi_attack.description: Multi-Attacks work similarly to Multi-Actions; every additional attack increases the Defence of every target by +2 for the purposes of the Multi-Attack. Each attack of your Multi-Attack must use the same weapon, and you cannot Shift as part of a Multi-Attack. Roll damage once, and apply the result to every target hit. If you Multi-Attack with a melee weapon, you must move into Engagement with all targets. You provoke Reflexive Attacks from any targets you leave Engagement with during this attack. If you cannot reach a target, they are not hit by the Multi-Attack. Thrown weapons can only be used in a Multi-Attack at the GM's discretion. It may be possible to Multi-Attack with thrown weapons in some circumstances, such as throwing a spear through two people standing next to each other.

all_out_attack.name: All-Out Attack
all_out_attack.description: When making an All-Out Attack, you gain +2 bonus dice to your melee attack dice pool, but you also suffer −2 to your Defence until the start of your next Turn. You can't take a Multi-Action if you All-Out Attack. You can Multi-Attack as part of an All-Out Attack; all of your attacks gain the same bonus.

fall_back.name: Fall Back
fall_back.description: You can use your Combat Action to fall back from close combat with any number of Threats. You may then use your Movement without suffering Reflexive Attacks from Engaged Threats. Your Movement must take you at least half your Speed in metres away from the enemy, or as far as possible if this is impossible due to the environment.

grapple.name: Grapple
grapple.description: You can use your Combat Action to try to grapple a target you are Engaged with. Make an Opposed Strength Test with the target. If you win, you grapple the target. Once grappled, a character is Restrained and may only use one-handed weapons. To break free from a grapple, a character must succeed an Opposed Strength Test using a Combat Action. You may attempt to grapple multiple targets using a Multi-Attack, but you must be Engaged with all targets and you can't grapple more targets than you have arms. A target gains +2 bonus dice to the Opposed Strength Test for every size category it is larger than you.

combined_attack.name: Combined Attack
combined_attack.description: You can elect to lead a Combined Attack on your Turn as a Combat Action. Any other Agents that have held their Action or have not taken their Turn yet may support the Combined Attack by sacrificing their Combat Action. Every Agent supporting the Combined Attack makes the same Test. Any supporting character that rolls more Icons than the target's Defence increases the leader's dice pool by +1 bonus dice. The leader then makes a Leadership (Wil) Test with the bonus dice from the supporters. If the number of Icons exceeds the target's Defence, the Combined Attack is successful, and the leader may choose to Shift for +ED as though this were a normal attack with a weapon. The leader then chooses one of the supporter's weapons that successfully hit the target to deal damage, plus any Extra Damage Dice from Shifting, +1 ED for each other supporter's weapon that successfully hit the target.

aim.name: Aim
aim.description: The Aim option allows you to sacrifice your Movement to focus on aiming a weapon. If you Aim, you cannot make a Movement but gain +1 bonus die to ranged attack Tests you make this Turn. You may also use Aim to ignore the penalty for firing at a target Engaged in melee instead of gaining bonus dice.

brace.name: Brace
brace.description: You can Brace for firing a weapon with the Heavy trait instead of making a Movement. You must have a suitable surface to Brace against, a tripod, or another means of stabilising your weapon. If you Brace, you negate the Heavy weapon trait.

shoot_through_cover.name: Shoot Through Cover
shoot_through_cover.description:
Some weapons are powerful enough that conventional cover is little more than a nuisance. If your target is visible, then you may spend a Combat Action to Shoot Through Cover. Make an Attack Test as normal and compare the result to the target's Defence, but don't add a Defence bonus for the target's cover. If your attack is successful, calculate damage as normal but add a bonus to the target's Resilience based on the type of cover they were behind.

Shoot Through Cover
Cover TypeResilience Bonus
Ultra-light materials: wooden planking, blast curtains+1
Light materials: thick wood, aluminium sheeting, interior doors+2
Medium materials: steel sheeting, flak board+4
Heavy materials: plasteel barricade, permacrete walls, security doors+8
Super-heavy materials: adamant reinforced barricade, blast doors, bunker walls+16

pinning_attack.name: Pinning Attack
pinning_attack.description: A Pinning Attack allows you to use suppressive fire to pin an enemy behind cover. If you have a ranged weapon with Salvo 1 or more, you can make a Pinning Attack as a Combat Action. A Pinning Attack deals no damage, and you must Reload to fire your weapon again after you make a Pinning Attack. The DN of a Pinning Attack is equal to the target's Resolve. If you succeed, the target is Pinned until the start of your next turn. You can Shift Icons to add additional targets on a 1-for-1 basis as long as they are within range and the Icons in your pool exceed the highest Resolve of all of your targets.

size_categories.name: Size Categories
size_categories.description:
Every character and creature has a Size Trait. Size affects how difficult a character is to hit and how stealthy it can be.

vision_penalties.description:
Darkness, photon flares, thermal smoke, and much more can impede a character's vision.

combat_complications.name: Combat Complications
combat_complications.description:
A result of 1 on the Wrath Die during an attack results in a Complication. Complications do not, by themselves, mean that your Test failed, only that something unusual or unfortunate has occurred.

determination.name: Determination
determination.description: You can roll Determination whenever you suffer one or more Wounds to convert them into Shock. Roll a number of dice equal to your Toughness. Every Icon you roll reduces the number of Wounds you suffer by 1 and causes you to suffer 1 Shock.

wounded.name: Wounded
wounded.description: If you have suffered any Wounds, you are Wounded. Wounded characters suffer a +1 DN penalty to all Tests.

dying.name: Dying
dying.description: If you suffer more Wounds than your Maximum Wounds, you are Dying. You are on the verge of expiration, unable to move or fight properly, and will perish if you do not receive medical attention soon. When you are Dying, you immediately suffer a Memorable Injury and fall Prone. You cannot stand up while you are Dying. Whenever you take any amount of damage that would cause you to suffer a Wound while Dying, you suffer a Traumatic Injury instead. If you suffer more Traumatic Injuries than your Tier + 1, you die. Whilst Dying, you are Wounded, and may only take one of the following Actions on your Turn: Crawl, a basic Combat Action (using no options such as Aim or Multi-Attack), or Fall Back. You may roll Determination when you take damage while Dying; if you use Determination to reduce any damage you take to 0, you do not suffer a Traumatic Injury. A Dying character can be moved by another character if they use a Combat Action to drag or lift a fallen comrade. If you recover any number of Wounds, you are no longer Dying.

annihilation.name: Annihilation
annihilation.description: If you suffer damage from a single attack that inflicts more than double your Maximum Wounds, you are dead. This is known as Annihilation.

falling.name: Falling
falling.description: When you fall a distance of 5 metres or more you suffer falling damage. You suffer 1 Mortal Wound, plus 1d3 Mortal Wounds for every extra 5 metres you fall.

reducing_defence.name: Reducing Defence
reducing_defence.description: Defence can be reduced to a minimum of 1 and cannot be further reduced beyond that point. A character can't take an action that would voluntarily reduce their Defence below 1.

attack_tests.name: Attack Tests
attack_tests.description: In the grim darkness of the 41st Millennium, there is only war. You'll likely make a lot of attacks, and to do so you'll usually make a Skill Test against your target's Defence — a number representing how difficult it is to hit someone.

attribute_tests.name: Attribute Tests
attribute_tests.description: When you're doing something that doesn't rely on your training you make a Test using only the relevant Attribute without a complementary Skill. For example, if you want to bash open a locked door, you need to pass a Strength Test. Attribute Tests are often more difficult than other Tests as your dice pool is smaller without the addition of a Skill.

corruption_test.name: Corruption Test
corruption_test.description: To make a Corruption Test, roll a dice pool of your Conviction Trait against the DN of the source of Corruption. Your Corruption Level can increase the DN of the Test. If you fail a Corruption Test, the GM gains +1 Ruin, and you gain Corruption Points equal to the difference between the number of Icons you rolled and the DN of the Test. If you roll a Complication on a failed Corruption Test, you gain double the amount of Corruption Points. If you roll a Wrath Critical on a Corruption Test, the DN of the Test is reduced by 2. You may choose to spend a single Wrath to reduce the DN of the current Corruption Test by one. This can't reduce the DN below 1.

dn.name: DN (Difficulty Number)
dn.description: The Difficulty Number (DN) is the number of Icons you need to pass a Test. If you roll equal to or greater than the DN, you've succeeded! DN 1 is Easy, DN 3 is Standard, DN 5 is Challenging, DN 7 is Difficult, and DN 9 is Extreme.

ed.name: ED (Extra Damage)
ed.description: Extra Damage Dice, abbreviated as ED. Circumstances and Abilities might award additional extra dice, presented as +X ED, with X being the number of Extra Damage Dice. When you deal damage, you roll any ED you have and add the total Icons (including Exalted Icons) to your total damage.

exalted_icon.name: Exalted Icon
exalted_icon.description: Any dice that roll a 6 count as an Exalted Icon. An Exalted Icon counts as two Icons. Exalted Icons can also be used to Shift for bonuses.

glory.name: Glory
glory.description: Glory is a resource you can earn and spend as a group to overcome the terrifying obstacles of the 41st Millennium. You and your party begin each session with 0 Glory in your collective pool. Any player can Shift an Exalted Icon to add 1 Glory to the pool; you can only do this once per Test. Whenever you roll a Wrath Critical on a Test, you add 1 Glory to the pool. The Glory pool has a maximum of either 6 or the number of players +2, whichever value is higher. Glory can be spent to add bonus dice to a Test, increase damage, Seize the Initiative, or increase the severity of a Critical Hit.

help.name: Help
help.description: You can use a Skill or Attribute to help someone else succeed on a Test. Say what you are doing to Help and what Attribute or Skill you are using. If the GM agrees that would be helpful, grab a number of dice equal to the Attribute or Skill Rating you are using to Help. Your ally can use those dice as bonus dice on their Test.

icon.name: Icon
icon.description: Any dice that roll a 4 or a 5 count as one Icon. An Icon is a measure of your success; the more you get, the more likely you are to succeed.

mortal_wound.name: Mortal Wound
mortal_wound.description: Mortal Wounds represent damage that is particularly brutal, exotic, or otherwise incredibly dangerous. Mortal Wounds ignore your Resilience, inflicting Wounds directly. Determination rolls can't be made to negate Mortal Wounds unless a Talent, item of Wargear, or the GM states otherwise.

opposed_tests.name: Opposed Tests
opposed_tests.description: Sometimes two characters try to perform actions that directly oppose each other — an Opposed Test. Both characters roll their respective Tests; the one who scores the greatest number of Icons is victorious. Anything that would raise the difficulty for one character is resolved as bonus dice for the opponent. If there is a tie, the victory goes to the side that initiated the Opposed Test. For example, if one character attempts to grapple another and the opposed Strength Test is a tie, the character who began the grapple is the winner. You don't need to include a Wrath Die for an Opposed Test unless you want to introduce the possibility of Complications.

psychic_power.name: Psychic Power
psychic_power.description: To use a psychic power, assemble a dice pool for your Psychic Mastery (Wil) Skill and roll against the power's DN. If the number of Icons equals or exceeds the psychic power's DN, you've successfully cast the power. Any result of 1 on any Wrath Dice triggers a Perils of the Warp Complication, regardless of success or failure.

rank.name: Rank
rank.description: Your Rank is a measure of your aptitude in your Tier. Some of your abilities and Talents may be modified by your Rank. Unless the GM says otherwise, you start at Rank 1. Your Rank increases every time you earn a total of 40 XP. Your Rank can't decrease, and can't go above the maximum of 3.

regroup.name: Regroup
regroup.description: A Regroup is a short period of downtime lasting approximately 1 hour. Regrouping generally occurs between encounters and affords you time to check ammo, tend injuries, assess the current situation, discuss tactics, and quickly grab something to eat and drink. If you have a Medicae Rating you can heal a single character during a Regroup. They regain Wounds equal to your Medicae (Int) dice pool.

resolve_tests.name: Resolve Tests
resolve_tests.description: When confronted by one of the many horrifying phenomena or terrifying creatures of Warhammer 40,000, you may have to resist Fear. To do so, roll a dice pool equal to your Resolve Trait.

respite.name: Respite
respite.description: Respite is a long period of downtime lasting at least 6 hours. You can spend 1-2 of the hours performing light activities, such as reading, eating, talking, maintaining Wargear, and standing watch over the group. If a strenuous activity that lasts for 1 hour or more interrupts the Respite, then the Respite must begin again to confer any benefit. If a Respite goes uninterrupted, your Shock and Wounds are reduced to zero, and your Wrath points reset to 2. Resetting Wrath in this way could increase or decrease your current Wrath. You cannot gain the benefits of a Respite if you are Dying.

ruin.name: Ruin
ruin.description: Ruin is a currency that the GM can spend to make the 41st Millennium even more dangerous. The GM starts every session with Ruin equal to the number of players, with a maximum of twice the number of players. The GM can spend Ruin to: Reroll Failures on any Test for an NPC; Seize the Initiative; Restore 1d3+3 of an NPC's Shock; make a Determination roll for an NPC; or Activate Ruin Actions possessed by powerful enemies.

shock.name: Shock
shock.description: Your Maximum Shock represents your mental fortitude in the face of combat and potential death. You start play with 0 Shock, and certain attacks or psychological assaults can cause you to suffer Shock. If you suffer more Shock than your Maximum Shock, you are Exhausted. If your Shock is reduced, you are no longer Exhausted and may take actions normally. You may use your Combat Action and expend a point of Wrath to restore Shock equal to your Rank + your Tier.

shifting.name: Shifting
shifting.description: When there is an Exalted Icon (a result of 6 on a die) in a Test's results, you might be able to remove it for special benefits. This is called Shifting. If you can remove an Exalted Icon from the results of a Test and there are still enough Icons to meet or exceed the DN, you can Shift that Exalted Icon. There is no limit to the amount of Exalted Icons you can Shift, as long as there are still enough Icons left in the results to meet or exceed the DN. You can Shift a Wrath Critical just like any other Exalted Icon. The effects of the Wrath Critical — gaining Glory and triggering a Critical Hit — trigger even if you Shift it. Common uses for Shifting include: Shifting for Extra Damage (+1 ED per Shift on attacks), Shifting for Glory (add 1 Glory to the pool, once per Test), Gain Information (1 answer per Shift), Improve Quality (make the result better), or Improve Speed (reduce time taken).

tier.name: Tier
tier.description: Your Tier is the power level of your group. Higher Tier groups face more perilous adventures and deadlier threats. There are 4 Tiers of play in Wrath & Glory. Higher Tiers correspond to higher power levels. Your Tier also ensures each of your characters are at the same power level and no character is overshadowed by another.

wrath.name: Wrath
wrath.description: Wrath Points represent your inner fire, your will to succeed, and the Emperor's light shining on you for one lucky moment. You start every session with 2 Wrath Points. You can spend a Wrath Point to: Reroll Failures (reroll every 1, 2, and 3 in your dice pool, once per Test; you can't reroll a Wrath Die that rolled a Complication); Narrative Declaration (add a minor narrative element to the scene; if the GM declines, the Wrath Point is not spent); or Restore Shock (as an Action, recover Shock equal to your Rank + your Tier; you can only do this if you are conscious).

wrath_die.name: Wrath Die
wrath_die.description: The Wrath Die replaces one of the d6 in your dice pool. If you only have one die in your pool for a Test, it is the Wrath Die. The Wrath Die works the same as every other die in your pool when determining Icons and Exalted Icons, but also activates specific effects when it lands on a 1 or 6. When the Wrath Die lands on a 6, you've rolled a Wrath Critical. When the Wrath Die lands on a 1, you've rolled a Complication.

abhuman.name: ABHUMAN
abhuman.description: Some mutated strains of Humanity, such as the muscular, oversized, impeccably loyal Ogryns, are allowed citizenship in parts of the Imperium due to their usefulness. These mutants are known as Abhumans.

absolvers_chapter.name: ABSOLVERS CHAPTER
absolvers_chapter.description: [AI-Generated] A Space Marine Chapter featured in the Vow of Absolution adventure, engaged in a penitent crusade to atone for a past failing.

adepta_sororitas.name: ADEPTA SORORITAS
adepta_sororitas.description: A sect of righteous warrior-monks that form the army of the Adeptus Ministorum, waging Wars of Faith to see the God-Emperor's will done.

adeptus_administratum.name: ADEPTUS ADMINISTRATUM
adeptus_administratum.description: The colossal bureaucratic organisation that governs the Imperium. They keep the records, levy the tithes, assemble the munitions, and fulfill a numberless host of other clerical duties.

adeptus_arbites.name: ADEPTUS ARBITES
adeptus_arbites.description: [AI-Generated] The enforcers of Imperial law, the Adeptus Arbites maintain order across the Imperium through unyielding adherence to the Lex Imperialis. They are judge, jury, and executioner.

adeptus_astartes.name: ADEPTUS ASTARTES
adeptus_astartes.description: The Space Marines: genetically enhanced transhuman super soldiers who know no fear.

adeptus_astra_telepathica.name: ADEPTUS ASTRA TELEPATHICA
adeptus_astra_telepathica.description: The organisation responsible for recruiting and training Psykers for the Imperium.

adeptus_custodes.name: ADEPTUS CUSTODES
adeptus_custodes.description: [AI-Generated] The Emperor's personal bodyguard, the Adeptus Custodes are the mightiest warriors in the Imperium. Each Custodian is a masterwork of genetic engineering, surpassing even the Adeptus Astartes in combat prowess.

adeptus_mechanicus.name: ADEPTUS MECHANICUS
adeptus_mechanicus.description: Adherents to the Cult Mechanicus, the Mars-based cult of the machine that supply the Imperium with its advanced technology and guard the sacred knowledge of its workings.

adeptus_ministorum.name: ADEPTUS MINISTORUM
adeptus_ministorum.description: The state church of the Imperium that propagates and maintains the worship of the God-Emperor to unite His people.

administratum.name: ADMINISTRATUM
administratum.description: [AI-Generated] A shortened form of Adeptus Administratum, the colossal bureaucratic organisation that governs the Imperium.

aeldari.name: AELDARI
aeldari.description: An ancient xenos Species whose declining empire once spanned the galaxy. They are naturally psychic, long lived, and old enemies of the Imperium. Also a Psychic Power Keyword denoting an advanced psychic power employed only by the Aeldari Species.

aeronautica_imperialis.name: AERONAUTICA IMPERIALIS
aeronautica_imperialis.description: The Aeronautica Imperialis are part of the Navis Imperialis, and are responsible for Imperial in-atmosphere aviation.

air_caste.name: AIR CASTE
air_caste.description: [AI-Generated] The pilot caste of the T'au Empire, responsible for atmospheric and void operations. Air Caste T'au have adapted to life in low gravity and are expert aviators.

aircraft.name: AIRCRAFT
aircraft.description: [AI-Generated] A vehicle capable of atmospheric flight.

alaitoc.name: ALAITOC
alaitoc.description: [AI-Generated] An Asuryani Craftworld known for its strict adherence to the Path system and its large number of Rangers and Pathfinders who roam the galaxy.

anathema_psykana.name: ANATHEMA PSYKANA
anathema_psykana.description: [AI-Generated] The Sisters of Silence are the militant arm of the Anathema Psykana. These warrior-nulls are psychic blanks whose very presence disrupts the Warp, making them uniquely suited to combating psykers and daemons.

anhrathe.name: ANHRATHE
anhrathe.description: Anhrathe is the Aeldari name for the Corsairs, the piratical outcasts that form Coteries.

anti_grav.name: ANTI-GRAV
anti_grav.description: [AI-Generated] Equipment or vehicles that use anti-gravitational technology to hover or fly.

any.name: ANY
any.description: [AI-Generated] Indicates wargear or equipment that can be used by any faction, without restriction.

any_keyword.name: [ANY]
any_keyword.description: This Keyword can be replaced with any other Keyword of your choice. In almost all circumstances it makes the most sense to select a Faction Keyword. Discuss your choice with your GM and the group to ensure it makes sense for the narrative of your game.

arc.name: ARC
arc.description: Ancient weapons that spew blasts of electricity that tear asunder biological nerves and mechanical systems.

aspect_shrine.name: ASPECT SHRINE
aspect_shrine.description: [AI-Generated] A temple dedicated to one of the Aspects of Khaine where Asuryani train on the Path of the Warrior, each shrine devoted to a particular style of combat.

aspect_warrior.name: ASPECT WARRIOR
aspect_warrior.description: Asuryani that follow the Path of the Warrior devote themselves to a specific aspect of Khaine, the Aeldari God of War. These Asuryani are known as Aspect Warriors.

astartes.name: ASTARTES
astartes.description: [AI-Generated] A shortened form of Adeptus Astartes, used to identify Space Marines regardless of loyalty.

astra_cartographica.name: ASTRA CARTOGRAPHICA
astra_cartographica.description: A sub-faction of the Administratum, the Astra Cartographica are tasked with mapping the vast expanse of the galaxy.

astra_militarum.name: ASTRA MILITARUM
astra_militarum.description: The largest military force of the Imperium, numbering billions of mortal Humans.

asuryani.name: ASURYANI
asuryani.description: The Aeldari name for the citizens that live disciplined lives on Craftworlds.

auditory.name: AUDITORY
auditory.description: A psychic power that has an audible effect.

autarch.name: AUTARCH
autarch.description: [AI-Generated] An Asuryani leader who has walked many of the Paths, combining their diverse experience into masterful strategic and tactical command.

avachrus_forge_world.name: AVACHRUS FORGE WORLD
avachrus_forge_world.description: [AI-Generated] A Forge World of the Adeptus Mechanicus, the planet Avachrus and its manufacturing output.

bad_moon.name: BAD MOON
bad_moon.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Clan known for their wealth and love of ostentatious dakka, Bad Moons grow their teeth faster than other Orks, giving them more currency to spend on the biggest guns.

battlesuit.name: BATTLESUIT
battlesuit.description: [AI-Generated] An advanced T'au powered exoskeleton designed for combat, ranging from personal Crisis Suits to massive Riptide and Stormsurge platforms.

beast.name: BEAST
beast.description: Unintelligent creatures that do not possess the self-awareness and high intelligence of Humans.

beast_snagga.name: BEAST SNAGGA
beast_snagga.description: [AI-Generated] Orks who eschew advanced technology in favour of riding and hunting massive beasts, priding themselves on their toughness and ability to fight monsters hand-to-hand.

beastmaster.name: BEASTMASTER
beastmaster.description: [AI-Generated] A Drukhari warrior who captures and controls exotic and dangerous beasts, unleashing them upon their enemies in the arenas and on the battlefield.

beasts.name: BEASTS
beasts.description: [AI-Generated] Creatures that are animals or beast-like in nature, lacking true sapience but often dangerous in combat.

black_legion.name: BLACK LEGION
black_legion.description: [AI-Generated] The largest and most powerful of the Traitor Legions, formerly the Luna Wolves and Sons of Horus, now united under the Warmaster Abaddon in their war against the Imperium.

black_templars.name: BLACK TEMPLARS
black_templars.description: [AI-Generated] A zealous successor Chapter of the Imperial Fists, the Black Templars are the largest Space Marine Chapter and are engaged in an eternal crusade to purge the enemies of the Emperor.

blade.name: BLADE
blade.description: A simple bladed weapon, such as a Sword or Knife.

blades_for_hire.name: BLADES FOR HIRE
blades_for_hire.description: [AI-Generated] Aeldari mercenaries and outcasts who sell their combat skills to the highest bidder, including Incubi, Mandrakes, and other deadly fighters.

blood_angels.name: BLOOD ANGELS
blood_angels.description: [AI-Generated] A noble First Founding Space Marine Chapter cursed with the genetic flaw known as the Red Thirst and the Black Rage, a psychic echo of their Primarch Sanguinius's death.

blood_axe.name: BLOOD AXE
blood_axe.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Clan regarded with suspicion by other Orks for their willingness to use cunning tactics, camouflage, and even negotiate with humans.

bolt.name: BOLT
bolt.description: A firearm that fires the self-propelled, mass-reactive rounds known as Bolts, which explode when they penetrate the enemy.

boss.name: BOSS
boss.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork leader who has risen to command through sheer size, brutality, and force of personality. Ork society is a violent meritocracy where the biggest and meanest rule.

brokhyr.name: BRÔKHYR
brokhyr.description: [AI-Generated] The engineer caste of the Leagues of Votann, Brôkhyr are master craftsmen who maintain and create the advanced technology of the Kin.

broodmind.name: BROODMIND
broodmind.description: [AI-Generated] A psychic discipline keyword for powers that tap into the gestalt psychic consciousness of a Genestealer Cult, connecting hybrids and cultists to the will of the Patriarch.

cadian.name: CADIAN
cadian.description: [AI-Generated] Soldiers hailing from the fortress world of Cadia, renowned as the finest soldiers in the Astra Militarum and the Imperium's first line of defence against Chaos.

canoptek.name: CANOPTEK
canoptek.description: [AI-Generated] Autonomous robotic constructs that maintain and defend Necron tomb worlds, ranging from Scarab swarms to massive Spyders and Wraiths.

catachan.name: CATACHAN
catachan.description: [AI-Generated] Jungle fighters from the death world of Catachan, among the toughest human warriors in the galaxy, hardened by a lifetime of surviving their lethal homeworld.

chain.name: CHAIN
chain.description: A weapon that uses sharp, motorised teeth to inflict maximum damage.

champion.name: CHAMPION
champion.description: [AI-Generated] An elite warrior who serves as the foremost fighter of their unit or warband, often bearing the finest wargear and leading from the front.

chaos.name: CHAOS
chaos.description: The forces and worshippers of the Chaos Gods. Also a Psychic Power Keyword denoting a psychic power employed only by the forces of Chaos.

chaplain_keyword.name: CHAPLAIN
chaplain_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] A Space Marine spiritual leader who tends to the Chapter's faith and fury, inspiring battle-brothers to righteous zeal in combat.

chapter.name: [CHAPTER]
chapter.description: Every Space Marine belongs to a Chapter, an organisation of 1,000 Adeptus Astartes with their own strictures, cultures, traditions, and inherited gene-seed.

chemical.name: CHEMICAL
chemical.description: [AI-Generated] A weapon that uses chemical agents to harm targets.

chieftain.name: CHIEFTAN
chieftain.description: [AI-Generated] A tribal leader or warlord who commands through strength and authority.

clan.name: [CLAN]
clan.description: An Ork Clan is a cultural mindset or timeless philosophy that unites large gatherings of Orks. Each has their own focus on a specific part of Ork kultur, such as Brutality, Kunnin', or lootin'.

cog.name: COG
cog.description: [AI-Generated] A robotic construct used by the Leagues of Votann, serving various support and combat roles within Kin society.

command_squad.name: COMMAND SQUAD
command_squad.description: [AI-Generated] An elite bodyguard unit that accompanies and protects a commanding officer, typically including specialists such as medics, standard bearers, and veterans.

commander_keyword.name: COMMANDER
commander_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] A senior T'au military leader, typically piloting an advanced battlesuit and directing forces from the front lines.

coterie.name: [COTERIE]
coterie.description: A Coterie is a collective of Aeldari Corsairs, a band of opportunistic space pirates that have each left their former lives to indulge in adventure and hedonistic pursuits. A Coterie is a loose organisation based on camaraderie and shared goals, and may include both Aeldari and Drukhari. Examples: Greensteel Corsairs, Yriel's Eldritch Raiders, Sunblitz Brotherhood, Void Dragons.

court_of_the_archon.name: COURT OF THE ARCHON
court_of_the_archon.description: [AI-Generated] The inner circle of a Drukhari Archon, consisting of exotic and dangerous retainers such as Sslyth bodyguards, Lhamaean poisoners, and Medusae.

coven.name: [COVEN]
coven.description: [AI-Generated] A shortened form of [HAEMONCULUS COVEN], representing a player's choice of Drukhari Haemonculus Coven.

craftworld.name: [CRAFTWORLD]
craftworld.description: A Craftworld is a gargantuan wraithbone voidcraft the size of a small planet housing a huge population of Asuryani Aeldari. Each Craftworld has its own unique culture, and is powered by an Infinity Circuit which houses the spirits of the Craftworld's deceased citizens. Examples: Ul-Khari, Alaitoc, Biel-Tan, Iyanden.

creations_of_bile.name: CREATIONS OF BILE
creations_of_bile.description: [AI-Generated] The twisted experiments and enhanced warriors created by Fabius Bile, the renegade Apothecary who seeks to perfect and surpass the Emperor's work in creating Space Marines.

crimson_fists.name: CRIMSON FISTS
crimson_fists.description: [AI-Generated] A successor Chapter of the Imperial Fists known for their stoic resilience and disciplined bolter drill, nearly destroyed by an Ork WAAAGH! on their homeworld of Rynn's World.

cryptek.name: CRYPTEK
cryptek.description: [AI-Generated] Necron techno-sorcerers who wield arcane technologies that appear as magic, specialising in fields such as chronomancy, psychomancy, or technomancy.

ctan.name: C'TAN
ctan.description: [AI-Generated] Ancient star-eating entities of immense power, the C'tan were once worshipped as gods by the Necrontyr. Now shattered into shards, they are enslaved as weapons by the Necron dynasties.

cthonian.name: CTHONIAN
cthonian.description: [AI-Generated] A warrior hailing from the subterranean mining world of Cthonia, known for their savage gang-fighting traditions.

cult.name: [CULT]
cult.description: [AI-Generated] A shortened form of [WYCH CULT], representing a player's choice of Drukhari Wych Cult.

cult_mechanicus.name: CULT MECHANICUS
cult_mechanicus.description: [AI-Generated] The religious order within the Adeptus Mechanicus devoted to the worship of the Omnissiah, the Machine God. Members of the Cult Mechanicus seek to unlock the mysteries of technology through faith and ritual.

cult_of_destruction.name: CULT OF DESTRUCTION
cult_of_destruction.description: [AI-Generated] A destructive cult of Chaos devoted to annihilation and the tearing down of Imperial order.

cult_of_strife.name: CULT OF STRIFE
cult_of_strife.description: [AI-Generated] The largest and most prestigious of the Drukhari Wych Cults, led by Lelith Hesperax, renowned for the sublime skill and savage grace of their gladiatorial performances.

cultist.name: CULTIST
cultist.description: [AI-Generated] Mortal followers of the Ruinous Powers who serve Chaos through worship, sabotage, and rebellion against the Imperium.

daemon.name: DAEMON
daemon.description: The twisted creatures native to the Immaterium are named daemons and are believed to be made of Warp energy.

daemon_engine.name: DAEMON ENGINE
daemon_engine.description: [AI-Generated] A war machine fused with a bound daemon, combining mechanical might with daemonic fury. These unholy constructs are weapons of terror on the battlefield.

daemon_prince.name: DAEMON PRINCE
daemon_prince.description: [AI-Generated] A mortal champion of Chaos who has been elevated to daemonhood by the Ruinous Powers as a reward for exceptional service, becoming an immortal being of immense power.

daemonkin.name: DAEMONKIN
daemonkin.description: [AI-Generated] Mortal followers of Chaos whose bodies have been partially transformed by Warp energy, blurring the line between mortal and daemon.

dark_angels.name: DARK ANGELS
dark_angels.description: [AI-Generated] A secretive First Founding Space Marine Chapter obsessed with hunting the Fallen — traitorous members of their Legion who turned during the Horus Heresy.

dark_commune.name: DARK COMMUNE
dark_commune.description: [AI-Generated] The leadership cadre of a Chaos cult, typically consisting of a Cult Demagogue and their inner circle of blessed devotees.

dark_mechanicum.name: DARK MECHANICUM
dark_mechanicum.description: Traitors and renegades formerly of the Cult Mechanicus, those of the Dark Mechanicum commit the sins of worshipping Chaos, abusing forbidden technologies, and practicing innovation, including the abject horrors of daemon-infused tech.

darkstar.name: DARKSTAR
darkstar.description: [AI-Generated] A designation for specialised equipment associated with the Leagues of Votann Darkstar technology.

death_guard.name: DEATH GUARD
death_guard.description: [AI-Generated] A Traitor Legion devoted to Nurgle, the Plague God. Bloated with disease and corruption, the Death Guard spread plague and entropy wherever they tread.

death_jester_keyword.name: DEATH JESTER
death_jester_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] A Harlequin who embodies the role of death in their performances, wielding terrifying weapons and wearing the spirit stones of fallen Harlequins.

deathskullz.name: DEATHSKULLZ
deathskullz.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Clan known for their superstitious nature and compulsive looting, Deathskullz paint themselves blue for luck and scavenge everything they can from the battlefield.

deathwatch.name: DEATHWATCH
deathwatch.description: [AI-Generated] The militant arm of the Ordo Xenos, the Deathwatch is composed of Space Marines drawn from many Chapters who specialise in combating the alien threats to the Imperium.

demigod.name: DEMIGOD
demigod.description: [AI-Generated] A being of extraordinary power, approaching the divine in might and influence.

destroyer_cult.name: DESTROYER CULT
destroyer_cult.description: [AI-Generated] An organisation of Necron Destroyers unified by their obsessive drive to eradicate all organic life from the galaxy.

destroyer_keyword.name: DESTROYER
destroyer_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] Necrons consumed by an insatiable hatred for all living things, who have abandoned reason and dynasty in favour of pure extermination.

dok.name: DOK
dok.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Painboy — a crude surgeon who performs brutal medical procedures on other Orks using scavenged tools and a natural Orkoid instinct for anatomy.

dreadnought.name: DREADNOUGHT
dreadnought.description: [AI-Generated] A walking war machine piloted by the mortally wounded remains of a Space Marine hero, interred within a sarcophagus to continue fighting beyond death.

drone.name: DRONE
drone.description: [AI-Generated] An autonomous T'au artificial intelligence unit that provides support functions such as shield projection, markerlight targeting, or direct firepower.

drukhari.name: DRUKHARI
drukhari.description: Cruel and depraved, the 'Dark Eldar' are Aeldari who have succumbed utterly to their Species' bottomless hedonism. Since the fall of the Aeldari, they have lived in the foul Webway metropolis Commorragh, subsisting their twisted souls on the psychic emanations of the suffering of their many slaves.

dynastic_agent.name: DYNASTIC AGENT
dynastic_agent.description: [AI-Generated] A Necron operative who carries out the will of their dynasty's Phaeron, serving as spy, assassin, or diplomat.

dynasty.name: [DYNASTY]
dynasty.description: The Warrant of Trade that gives a Rogue Trader their power is often subject to inheritance, with the wealth and influence of a Rogue Trader's Dynasty growing through the generations. Each Dynasty may have wildly different inherited resources, or a reputation to uphold. Examples: Varonius, Kahlixian, Armengarde.

earth_caste.name: EARTH CASTE
earth_caste.description: [AI-Generated] The engineer and artisan caste of the T'au Empire, responsible for construction, manufacturing, and technological innovation.

emperors_children.name: EMPEROR'S CHILDREN
emperors_children.description: [AI-Generated] A Traitor Legion devoted to Slaanesh, the Lord of Excess. Once paragons of martial perfection, they now pursue ever greater sensory extremes.

energy.name: ENERGY
energy.description: [AI-Generated] A weapon that fires directed energy blasts.

eshin.name: ESHIN
eshin.description: [AI-Generated] A Hrud clan specialising in stealth, espionage, and assassination.

ethereal_caste.name: ETHEREAL CASTE
ethereal_caste.description: [AI-Generated] The ruling caste of the T'au Empire. Ethereals guide T'au society through their enigmatic influence, inspiring absolute loyalty and devotion to the Greater Good.

evil_sunz.name: EVIL SUNZ
evil_sunz.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Clan obsessed with speed, Evil Sunz paint their vehicles and wargear red in the belief that 'red wunz go fasta', and favour fast-moving assaults.

exarch.name: EXARCH
exarch.description: [AI-Generated] An Asuryani Aspect Warrior who has become trapped on the Path of the Warrior, unable to leave their shrine. Exarchs are peerless fighters who lead their Aspect's warriors in battle.

exotic.name: EXOTIC
exotic.description: A strange or unusual weapon that defies usual categorisation.

explosive_keyword.name: EXPLOSIVE
explosive_keyword.description: A weapon that explodes or fires explosives.

farseer_keyword.name: FARSEER
farseer_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] The most powerful Asuryani psykers, Farseers guide their Craftworlds by reading the skeins of fate and manipulating future events to protect their people.

farsight_enclaves.name: FARSIGHT ENCLAVES
farsight_enclaves.description: [AI-Generated] A breakaway faction of the T'au Empire led by Commander Farsight, who rejected the authority of the Ethereal Caste and established an independent military enclave.

fellgor.name: FELLGOR
fellgor.description: [AI-Generated] Beastmen corrupted by Chaos, the Fellgor are savage, goat-headed mutants who serve as shock troops in Chaos warbands.

fire_caste.name: FIRE CASTE
fire_caste.description: [AI-Generated] The warrior caste of the T'au Empire, responsible for all military operations. Fire Caste T'au are bred for combat and trained from birth in the art of war.

fire_keyword.name: FIRE
fire_keyword.description: As a Wargear Keyword: A weapon that shoots flames or incorporates fire. As a Psychic Power Keyword: A psychic power that manipulates heat or conjures flame.

first_company_veteran.name: 1ST COMPANY VETERAN
first_company_veteran.description: [AI-Generated] An elite Space Marine who has earned a place in their Chapter's First Company, the most experienced and decorated warriors entrusted with Terminator armour and the Chapter's most vital missions.

flak.name: FLAK
flak.description: A sturdy, lightweight, mass-produced form of armour.

flame.name: FLAME
flame.description: [AI-Generated] A weapon that projects burning promethium or other incendiary substances.

flayer.name: FLAYER
flayer.description: [AI-Generated] A Necron afflicted by the Flayer Virus, a curse that drives them to obsessively collect the skin and flesh of the living in a grotesque mockery of their lost mortality.

flesh_tearers.name: FLESH TEARERS
flesh_tearers.description: [AI-Generated] A savage successor Chapter of the Blood Angels, the Flesh Tearers are renowned for their ferocity in battle and their particularly strong susceptibility to the Black Rage.

flyer.name: FLYER
flyer.description: [AI-Generated] A vehicle designed primarily for atmospheric flight operations.

force_field.name: FORCE FIELD
force_field.description: [AI-Generated] Protective energy fields generated by technology or psychic power that can deflect or absorb incoming attacks.

force_keyword.name: FORCE
force_keyword.description: Psykers can channel Warp energies into a Force weapon, unnaturally amplifying the power of their blows.

forge_world.name: [FORGE WORLD]
forge_world.description: The Cult Mechanicus lay claim to many Imperial planets, coveting their useful mineral resources and converting their entire surface to vast interlinked manufactorums. Each has their own particular culture, methods of worshipping the Omnissiah, and specialised manufacturing patterns. Examples: Avachrus, Mars, Ryza, Metalica.

freebooter.name: FREEBOOTER
freebooter.description: [AI-Generated] Ork pirates and mercenaries who operate independently of the major Clans, hiring themselves out to the highest bidder or raiding voidships for plunder.

gaunt.name: GAUNT
gaunt.description: [AI-Generated] The most numerous Tyranid bioforms, Gaunts are small, fast, and expendable creatures that overwhelm enemies through sheer numbers.

gauss.name: GAUSS
gauss.description: [AI-Generated] Necron weapons that strip matter apart at a molecular level using focused energy beams.

genestealer.name: GENESTEALER
genestealer.description: [AI-Generated] A Tyranid bioform specialising in infiltration and infection, Genestealers implant their genetic material into host species to create hybrid cultists who prepare worlds for consumption.

genestealer_cult.name: GENESTEALER CULT
genestealer_cult.description: The Genestealer life cycle infects other creatures, warping their minds and bodies to serve the grotesque Tyranid as it grows in power and plans total insurrection. The brainwashed and hybridised lifeforms that worship the Genestealer Patriarch are known as Genestealer Cultists.

goff.name: GOFF
goff.description: [AI-Generated] An Ork Clan that values close combat above all else, Goffs are the toughest and most belligerent of all Orks, favouring brutal melee over shooting.

grav.name: GRAV
grav.description: [AI-Generated] Weapons that manipulate gravitational forces to crush targets under their own weight.

greater_daemon.name: GREATER DAEMON
greater_daemon.description: [AI-Generated] The most powerful daemons of the Chaos Gods, Greater Daemons are towering entities of immense destructive capability that serve as generals and champions of their patron deity.

grenade.name: GRENADE
grenade.description: [AI-Generated] A thrown or launched explosive device.

gretchin.name: GRETCHIN
gretchin.description: [AI-Generated] Small, cowardly Orkoid creatures that serve as servants, ammunition runners, and cannon fodder for their larger Ork masters. Also known as Grots.

grey_knights.name: GREY KNIGHTS
grey_knights.description: [AI-Generated] A secretive Chapter of Space Marines specialising in combating daemons. Every Grey Knight is a potent psyker, and their very existence is kept hidden from the wider Imperium.

grot.name: GROT
grot.description: [AI-Generated] Another name for Gretchin — diminutive Orkoid creatures used as menial workers and living shields by the Orks.

haemacolyte.name: HAEMACOLYTE
haemacolyte.description: [AI-Generated] An apprentice to a Drukhari Haemonculus, learning the dark arts of flesh-sculpting and pain extraction.

haemonculus_coven.name: [HAEMONCULUS COVEN]
haemonculus_coven.description: Haemonculi are Drukhari that have mastered the arts of inflicting torturous pain and the reshaping of flesh through biological manipulation. They frequently gather together to pursue their twisted goals as a coven, attended by the grotesque monstrosities they create. Examples: Prophets of Flesh, Dark Creed, Coven of Twelve.

haemonculus_keyword.name: HAEMONCULUS
haemonculus_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] A Drukhari master of the flesh-craft, Haemonculi are ancient and twisted beings who sculpt living creatures into grotesque forms and hold the secret to resurrection.

hand_of_the_archon.name: HAND OF THE ARCHON
hand_of_the_archon.description: [AI-Generated] Elite warriors and agents who serve directly under a Drukhari Archon, carrying out their master's will with deadly precision.

harlequin.name: HARLEQUIN
harlequin.description: The inscrutable worshipers of the Laughing God Cegorach, the Harlequins are Aeldari that tour the galaxy in troupes, mounting theatrical reenactments of Aeldari history and intervening in combats with deadly efficiency.

heavy_keyword.name: HEAVY
heavy_keyword.description: A particularly weighty piece of equipment.

hekatarii.name: HEKATARII
hekatarii.description: [AI-Generated] The gladiatorial warriors of the Drukhari Wych Cults, trained in acrobatic close combat and the use of exotic combat drugs.

hellion.name: HELLION
hellion.description: [AI-Generated] Young Drukhari gangers who ride skyboards through the spires of Commorragh, swooping into battle with hooked blades to snatch victims from the ground.

herald_keyword.name: HERALD
herald_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] A lesser daemonic leader that serves as a lieutenant and messenger of a Chaos God, commanding lesser daemons in battle.

heretek.name: HERETEK
heretek.description: [AI-Generated] A member of the Dark Mechanicum or a renegade Tech-Priest who has abandoned the orthodox teachings of the Cult Mechanicus in pursuit of forbidden knowledge.

heretic.name: HERETIC
heretic.description: Those that have sinned, blasphemed, or turned traitorously from the light of the Emperor are known as heretics.

heretic_astartes.name: HERETIC ASTARTES
heretic_astartes.description: [AI-Generated] Space Marines who have turned from the Emperor's light and pledged themselves to the Ruinous Powers of Chaos. Also known as Chaos Space Marines, they are among the most dangerous threats to the Imperium.

hernkyn.name: HERNKYN
hernkyn.description: [AI-Generated] The scouts and pioneers of the Leagues of Votann, Hernkyn range far ahead of Kin expeditions to survey new territory and identify threats.

hive_fleet.name: [HIVE FLEET]
hive_fleet.description: [AI-Generated] A Tyranid Hive Fleet is a vast armada of bio-ships traveling through the void, consuming all biomass in its path. Each Hive Fleet has its own distinct evolutionary adaptations and tactical tendencies.

house.name: [HOUSE]
house.description: [AI-Generated] A Navigator House is one of the ancient noble families of the Navis Nobilite. Each House has its own hereditary mutations, political alliances, and traditions surrounding their role as Warp navigators.

howling_banshee.name: HOWLING BANSHEE
howling_banshee.description: [AI-Generated] An Asuryani Aspect Warrior shrine devoted to close combat, whose members wear psychosonic masks that emit a terrifying scream to stun enemies before the killing blow.

hrud.name: HRUD
hrud.description: [AI-Generated] A mysterious and rarely encountered xenos species that exudes an entropy field, causing rapid ageing and decay in everything around them.

human.name: HUMAN
human.description: [AI-Generated] A baseline human, without the genetic modifications of Astartes, the psychic gifts of Psykers, or the mutations of Abhumans.

imperial.name: IMPERIAL
imperial.description: [AI-Generated] A broad designation for anything belonging to or aligned with the Imperium of Man.

imperial_fists.name: IMPERIAL FISTS
imperial_fists.description: [AI-Generated] A First Founding Space Marine Chapter renowned for their expertise in siege warfare and unwavering dedication to the defence of the Imperium.

imperial_navy.name: IMPERIAL NAVY
imperial_navy.description: [AI-Generated] The common name for the Navis Imperialis, the Imperial organisation responsible for void warfare and the transportation of military forces across the galaxy.

imperium.name: IMPERIUM
imperium.description: The vast interstellar empire of Humanity that spans over a million worlds, led by the Emperor from Holy Terra.

incubi.name: INCUBI
incubi.description: [AI-Generated] Elite Drukhari warriors who serve as bodyguards and mercenaries, clad in heavy armour and wielding massive two-handed klaives. They train in shrines dedicated to the art of killing.

incubus_keyword.name: INCUBUS
incubus_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] The singular form of Incubi — elite Drukhari warriors who serve as bodyguards and mercenaries, wielding massive two-handed klaives.

inquisition.name: INQUISITION
inquisition.description: A clandestine organisation given absolute power to battle the greatest threats to the Imperium: heresy, xenos, and daemons.

iron_hands.name: IRON HANDS
iron_hands.description: [AI-Generated] A First Founding Space Marine Chapter with deep ties to the Adeptus Mechanicus, known for replacing their flesh with bionics in pursuit of the perceived weakness of the organic form.

iyanden.name: IYANDEN
iyanden.description: [AI-Generated] An Asuryani Craftworld devastated by a Tyranid Hive Fleet, now relying heavily on Wraith Constructs animated by the spirits of its dead to bolster its dwindling population.

jokaero.name: JOKAERO
jokaero.description: A simian-like xenos Species with an incredible innate understanding of technology.

jump_jets.name: JUMP JETS
jump_jets.description: [AI-Generated] Propulsion systems that allow T'au battlesuits and infantry to make powered leaps and short flights across the battlefield.

kabal.name: [KABAL]
kabal.description: The majority of the Drukhari are part of an immoral Kabal, a scattered army of raiders and slavers that pillage the galaxy through use of the Webway. Each Kabal is led by an Archon with their own twisted goals. Examples: Black Heart, Flayed Skull, Poisoned Tongue, Obsidian Rose.

kabal_keyword.name: KABAL
kabal_keyword.description: [AI-Generated] When used as an unbracketed keyword on wargear, indicates equipment associated with Drukhari Kabals.

kabalite.name: KABALITE
kabalite.description: [AI-Generated] A member of a Drukhari Kabal — the most common type of Drukhari warrior, forming the rank and file of raiding parties that pillage realspace for slaves and sustenance.

kan.name: KAN
kan.description: [AI-Generated] A crude Ork walker built by Mekboyz, typically housing a Gretchin or Ork pilot inside a ramshackle armoured shell bristling with weapons.

khorne.name: KHORNE
